page.title: 01The Area - N.E. Tiverton
page.content: The area is mainly countryside with lots of fields and farms. In the fields sheep and cattle graze and crops grow. There are three small hamlets in the area,Chettiscombe, Chevithorne and Craze Lowman. There is a small group of houses at East Mere There is no bus service to the little villages and there are no shops. The largest hamlet (Chevithorne) once had a Post Office/shop but this is now a private house. At Chevithorne is the church of St.Thomas and a Methodist Chapel.These have regular attendances. A baker,milkman and greengrocer deliver in the area and a mobile library visits fortnightly. Most people go to Tiverton for shopping.The children travel to the schools in Tiverton as the school in Chevithorne closed in 1954. The roads are narrow and twisty with high banks and hedges.
